workflow.name: Standardized workflow design pattern with color-coding system for teams
workflow.description:
## Objective

This template helps you create **clean, structured, and visually understandable workflows** that are easy to read, present to clients, and collaborate on with teams.

Whether you're onboarding a client, building reusable automations, or working across a team, this template gives you a **solid foundation** for workflow visual design and communication.

---

## ‚ú® What‚Äôs inside?

‚úÖ **Visual layout** structure suggestion
‚úÖ **Clear segmentation** into basic functional parts
‚úÖ **Color Coding** suggestion to define meaning of colors

üé® **Color-coded nodes** (with a built-in legend):
- üü© Green ‚Üí Operational and stable
- üü® Yellow ‚Üí Work in progress
- üü• Red ‚Üí Failing / error
- üüß Orange ‚Üí Needs review or improvement
- üü¶ Blue ‚Üí User input required
- ‚¨õ Dark grey ‚Üí Deprecated or paused

## üë• Who is this for?

This template is ideal for:
- üîß Freelancers or agencies delivering workflows to clients
- üë• Teams working together on large-scale automations
- üß± Anyone creating reusable templates or internal standards
- üßë‚Äçüéì Beginners who want to learn clean visual patterns supporting easy to maintain code base

---

## üì∏ Why use this?

> _‚ÄúA workflow should explain itself visually ‚Äì this template helps it do just that.‚Äù_

- Better **team collaboration**
- Easier **onboarding of new developers**
- **Faster understanding** for clients, even non-technical ones
- Reduces maintenance time in the long run

---

## üìå How to use

1. **Clone this template** and start from it when creating new workflows
2. **Keep color conventions consistent** (especially in early project stages)
3. Use it to **build a visual standard** across your team or organization

---

## üöß Reminder

This is a **non-functional template** ‚Äî it contains structure, patterns, and documentation examples only. Replace the example nodes with your own logic.

---

parameters.content:
## Triggers
- Normalized Inputs related to Sub-Workflow Trigger
- All triggers converge into a **normliized node** that can then be universally referenced downstream

## Collect or gather all data inputs needed
- in simple workflows this might be very short or missing
- this is the place to set any defaults for the workflow

## Business Logic A - working setup
- with **working** setup

# Key Objective of overall Workflow as a #-level Heading

## Often useful:
- Link or reference to the system triggering the workdlow

## Colorcoding for Nodes

üü© **Green**     ‚Äì Operational, runs in stable mode ‚úÖ  
üü• **Red**       ‚Äì Error / not operational ‚ùå  
üüß **Orange**    ‚Äì Partly Operational ‚ö†Ô∏è (e.g warning or improvement needs)  
üü® **Yellow**    ‚Äì Work in Progress üõ†Ô∏è  
üü¶ **Blue**      ‚Äì User Input required üôã (at run time)
‚¨õ **dark grey** ‚Äì On Hold / Deprecated
‚¨ú **White**     ‚Äì Neutral / inherits meaning of containing node

# START HERE

# Best Practices for visual structuring & visual hierarchy of workflow
This template is meant to showcase typical aspects and a clean, maintainable and visual structure. 
It does not provide and functionality, all nodes are for demonstration only.

 ‚û°Ô∏è Use this workflow as a template to start new workflows from.

## Design Patterns:
- Notes are **color coded** with a meaning as explained on right side in **"Colorcoding for Nodes"**
(keeping the color coding info in the workflow often helps to keep it visible during development phase)
- Each workflow contains typical phases for clean and maintainable code, they are **boxed within background nodes**

## How to use this template
- familirize yourself with the color coding and design patterns
- go through workflow node by node, reasoning is mentioned within nodes where applicable

nodes.name: Trigger | Normalized
nodes.notes: Fields are normalized with the Sub-workflow trigger as defining the "normalization" standard

nodes.name: Triggered from other Workflow
nodes.notes: Make a note for triggering workflow(s) somewhere for easy debugging later.

parameters.content:
## Business Logic B - currently in development
- with **working** setup

parameters.content:
## Business Logic C - Old Version, not used any more
- to keep fors ome time 
- should finally be managed in versions or be deleted
